titleStmt.title: The grand prerogative of humane nature namely, the souls naturall or native immortality, and freedome from corruption, shewed by many arguments, and also defended against the rash and rude conceptions of a late presumptuous authour, who hath adventured to impugne it. By G.H. Gent.
titleStmt.author: Holland, Guy, 1587?-1660.

titleStmt.title: The grand prerogative of humane nature namely, the souls naturall or native immortality, and freedome from corruption, shewed by many arguments, and also defended against the rash and rude conceptions of a late presumptuous authour, who hath adventured to impugne it. By G.H. Gent.
titleStmt.author: Holland, Guy, 1587?-1660.

editionStmt.edition: Now first published according to the perfect copie, and the authours mind.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Roger Daniel, and are to be sold by Antony Williamson, at the Queens Armes in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Variant: last line of imprint has "in St. Pauls Church-yard. An. 1653" in place of "in Pauls Church-yard. Anno 1653".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
